titles.en: Chapter 16 – The Laudation before the supplication

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّغْبَةِ وَ الرَّهْبَةِ وَ التَّضَرُّعِ وَ التَّبَتُّلِ وَ الِابْتِهَالِ وَ الِاسْتِعَاذَةِ وَ الْمَسْأَلَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 14 – The desire, and the awe, and the beseeching, and the devotion, and the invocation, and the seeking of Refuge, and the asking

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/50)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ يُونُسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَا مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ إِلَّا وَ لَهُ كَيْلٌ وَ وَزْنٌ إِلَّا الدُّمُوعُ فَإِنَّ الْقَطْرَةَ تُطْفِئُ بِحَاراً مِنْ نَارٍ فَإِذَا اغْرَوْرَقَتِ الْعَيْنُ بِمَائِهَا لَمْ يَرْهَقْ وَجْهاً قَتَرٌ وَ لَا ذِلَّةٌ فَإِذَا فَاضَتْ حَرَّمَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَى النَّارِ وَ لَوْ أَنَّ بَاكِياً بَكَى فِي أُمَّةٍ لَرُحِمُوا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Mansour Bin Yunus, from Muhammad Bin Marwan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is none from the things except that there is a measurement and a weight for it, except for the tears, for the drop can extinguish an ocean of fire. So when the eyes are overflowing by its water, neither will its face wear out nor be disgraced. So when they overflow, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Prohibits it upon the Fire, and if a weeper were to weep in a community, it would be Shown Mercy’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mansur ibn Yunus from Muhammad ibn Marwan from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “For everything there is weighing and measuring except tears. One drop of tears can extinguish oceans of fire. If the eyes flood with tears the face will not suffer hardships and humiliation. When tears flow out, Allah makes it forbidden for the fire and if a person weeps in a nation, such nation will receive favors.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/52)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ وَ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ يُونُسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَا مِنْ عَيْنٍ إِلَّا وَ هِيَ بَاكِيَةٌ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ إِلَّا عَيْناً بَكَتْ مِنْ خَوْفِ اللَّهِ وَ مَا اغْرَوْرَقَتْ عَيْنٌ بِمَائِهَا مِنْ خَشْيَةِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَّا حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ سَائِرَ جَسَدِهِ عَلَى النَّارِ وَ لَا فَاضَتْ عَلَى خَدِّهِ فَرَهِقَ ذَلِكَ الْوَجْهَ قَتَرٌ وَ لَا ذِلَّةٌ وَ مَا مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ إِلَّا وَ لَهُ كَيْلٌ وَ وَزْنٌ إِلَّا الدَّمْعَةُ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يُطْفِئُ بِالْيَسِيرِ مِنْهَا الْبِحَارَ مِنَ النَّارِ فَلَوْ أَنَّ عَبْداً بَكَى فِي أُمَّةٍ لَرَحِمَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ تِلْكَ الْأُمَّةَ بِبُكَاءِ ذَلِكَ الْعَبْدِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Jameela and Mansour Bin Yunus, from Muhammad Bin Marwan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘There is none from an eye except that it would be weeping on the Day of Judgment except for the eye which wept from fear of Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>; and there is no eye which overflows with its tears out of fear of Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic except that Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would Prohibit the rest of his body upon the Fire; nor would it overflow upon his cheek, that face would neither wear out not be disgraced; and there is none from the things except for it is a measurement and a weight except for the tears, for Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would Extinguish oceans of Fire by a little of it. So if a servant were to weep in a community, Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would be Merciful to that community due to the weeping of that servant (from fear of Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>)’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from ibn Faddal from abu Jamilah and Mansur ibn Yunus from Muhammad ibn Marwan from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Every eye will be weeping on the Day of Judgment except the eye that has wept for fear of Allah. Any eye that is flooded with tears for fear of Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious, will make it forbidden for the fire to burn the other parts of his body. Any eye from which tears flow over one’s checks such face will not face any suffering or humiliation. Everything has weighing and measuring tools except tears with a very little of which Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, will extinguish oceans of fire. If a servant (of Allah) weeps in a nation, Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, will grant favor to that nation because of the weeping of that one servant (of Allah).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/52)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ مُثَنًّى الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَا مِنْ قَطْرَةٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ قَطْرَةِ دُمُوعٍ فِي سَوَادِ اللَّيْلِ مَخَافَةً مِنَ اللَّهِ لَا يُرَادُ بِهَا غَيْرُهُ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Abdul Rahman Bin Abu Najran, from Musna Al Hannat, from Abu Hamza,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is none from a drop more Beloved to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic than a tear drop shed in the darkness of the night fearing from Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, not intending anything else by it’.
en.sarwar: 3. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn abu Najran from Muthanna al-Hannat from abu Hamza from abu la’ far (a.s.) who has said the following: “No drop is more beloved to Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious, than the drop of tears in the dark night for fear of Allah, and is intended to be just for Him alone.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/53)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ يُونُسَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ رَزِينٍ وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ وَ غَيْرِهِمَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كُلُّ عَيْنٍ بَاكِيَةٌ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ إِلَّا ثَلَاثَةً عَيْنٌ غُضَّتْ عَنْ مَحَارِمِ اللَّهِ وَ عَيْنٌ سَهِرَتْ فِي طَاعَةِ اللَّهِ وَ عَيْنٌ بَكَتْ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ اللَّهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Mansour Bin Yunus, from Salih Bin Razeyn and Muhammad Bin Marwan and other,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Every eye will be weeping on the Day of Judgment except for three – an eye closed from the Prohibitions of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and an eye kept open in obedience to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and an eye which wept in the middle of the night from fear of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mansur ibn Yunus from Salih ibn Razin and Muhammad ibn Marwan and others from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Every eye on the Day of Judgment will be weeping except three eyes: the eye that was shut closed from looking at things made unlawful by (the laws of) Allah, the eye that spends the night in awake in obedience to Allah and the eye that weeps inside the night for fear of Allah.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/53)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ وَ دُرُسْتَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَا مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ إِلَّا وَ لَهُ كَيْلٌ وَ وَزْنٌ إِلَّا الدُّمُوعُ فَإِنَّ الْقَطْرَةَ مِنْهَا تُطْفِئُ بِحَاراً مِنَ النَّارِ فَإِذَا اغْرَوْرَقَتِ الْعَيْنُ بِمَائِهَا لَمْ يَرْهَقْ وَجْهَهُ قَتَرٌ وَ لَا ذِلَّةٌ فَإِذَا فَاضَتْ حَرَّمَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَى النَّارِ وَ لَوْ أَنَّ بَاكِياً بَكَى فِي أُمَّةٍ لَرُحِمُوا .

en.hubeali: Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj and Dorost, from Muhammad Bin Marwan who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘There is none from the things except that from it is a measurement and a weight except for the tears, for a drop of it can extinguish oceans of fire. So whenever the eyes overflow with its water, its face will neither wear out from be disgraced. So when they overflow, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Prohibits it upon the Fire, and if a weeper in a community was to weep, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would be Merciful upon it (the whole community)’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ibn abu ‘Umayr has narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj and Drust from Muhammad ibn Marwan who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘everything has weighing and measuring tools except the tears. A drop of tear can extinguish oceans of fire. If the eye floods with tears, that face will not suffer anything or become humiliated. If the eye overflows with tears, Allah makes it forbidden for the fire to burn it and if a person weeps in a nation, that nation will receive favors.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/54)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ عِبَادِي لَمْ يَتَقَرَّبُوا إِلَيَّ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ ثَلَاثِ خِصَالٍ قَالَ مُوسَى يَا رَبِّ وَ مَا هُنَّ قَالَ يَا مُوسَى الزُّهْدُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَ الْوَرَعُ عَنِ الْمَعَاصِي وَ الْبُكَاءُ مِنْ خَشْيَتِي

قَالَ مُوسَى يَا رَبِّ فَمَا لِمَنْ صَنَعَ ذَا فَأَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَيْهِ يَا مُوسَى أَمَّا الزَّاهِدُونَ فِي الدُّنْيَا فَفِي الْجَنَّةِ وَ أَمَّا الْبَكَّاءُونَ مِنْ خَشْيَتِي فَفِي الرَّفِيعِ الْأَعْلَى لَا يُشَارِكُهُمْ أَحَدٌ وَ أَمَّا الْوَرِعُونَ عَنْ مَعَاصِيَّ فَإِنِّي أُفَتِّشُ النَّاسَ وَ لَا أُفَتِّشُهُمْ .

en.hubeali: Ibn Abu Umeyr, from a man from our companions who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Revealed unto Musa<sup>as</sup>: “My<sup>azwj</sup> servants would not (be able to) come closer to Me<sup>azwj</sup> with anything more Beloved to Me<sup>azwj</sup> than three characteritics”. Musa<sup>as</sup> said: ‘And what are these?’ He<sup>azwj</sup> Said: “O Musa<sup>as</sup>! (These are) the asceticism (avoiding indulgence) in the world, and the piety from the disobedience, and the weeping from My<sup>azwj</sup> fear”.

Musa<sup>as</sup>! O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! So what is for the one who does that?’ So Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Revealed unto him<sup>as</sup>: “O Musa<sup>as</sup>! As for the ascetic ones in the world, so they would be in the Paradise; and as for ones weeping from My<sup>azwj</sup> fear, so they would be in the lofty positions, no one would be participating with them; and as for the ones pious from My<sup>azwj</sup> disobedience, so I<sup>azwj</sup> will be Examining the people and would not be Examining them”’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ibn abu ‘Umayr has narrated from a man from certain individuals of his people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, sent revelations to Moses that said, “the most beloved of things to Me with which My servants can seek nearness to Me are three things.” Moses then asked, ‘Lord, what are they?’ The Lord said, ‘One’s reduced interest in worldly matters, restraint from sins and weeping for fear of Me.’ Moses asked, ‘Lord, what is then the reward for one who would do so?’ Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, sent him revelation that said, ‘Moses, people with reduced interest in the world will be in paradise, those weeping for fear of Me will be in a high position with whom no one else will share and those restraining from sins for their reward will have the privilege of freedom from My searching their affairs when I search all other people.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/54)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَكُونُ أَدْعُو فَأَشْتَهِي الْبُكَاءَ وَ لَا يَجِيئُنِي وَ رُبَّمَا ذَكَرْتُ بَعْضَ مَنْ مَاتَ مِنْ أَهْلِي فَأَرِقُّ وَ أَبْكِي فَهَلْ يَجُوزُ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ فَتَذَكَّرْهُمْ فَإِذَا رَقَقْتَ فَابْكِ وَ ادْعُ رَبَّكَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Usman Bin Isa, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I tend to supplicate and am desirous for the weeping, be it does not come to me, and sometimes I remember someone from my family who had died, so I cannot sleep and I weep. So is that allowed for me?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes. When you remember them and cannot sleep and weep, so supplicate to Your<sup>azwj</sup> Lord<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High’.
en.sarwar: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Once I said to abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘When I pray and plead before Allah for help, I like to weep but it does not come through, but if I recall members of my family who have died I may feel weeping. Is that permissible?’ The Imam said, ‘Yes, it is permissible. When you recall them and feel like weeping then pray to your Lord, the Most Blessed, the Most High.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/56)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَنْبَسَةَ الْعَابِدِ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنْ لَمْ تَكُنْ بِكَ بُكَاءٌ فَتَبَاكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Hassan Bin Mahboub, from Anbasa Al Aabid who said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If you cannot be with the weeping, so pretend (try) to weep’.
en.sarwar: 8. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from al-Hassan ibn Mahbub from ‘Anbasah al-‘Abid who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘If you cannot weep then make a weeping-like face.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/56)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ بَيَّاعِ السَّابِرِيِّ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنِّي أَتَبَاكَى فِي الدُّعَاءِ وَ لَيْسَ لِي بُكَاءٌ قَالَ نَعَمْ وَ لَوْ مِثْلَ رَأْسِ الذُّبَابِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Fazzal, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub, from Saeed Bin Yasaar Baya’a Al Sabiry who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Can I pretend (try) to cry during the supplication and there is no weeping for me’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, and even if it (the tear drop) is like the head of the fly’.
en.sarwar: 9. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ibn Faddal from Yunus ibn Ya’qub from Sa’Id ibn Yasar Bayya’ al-Sabiri who has said the following: “Once I said to abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘In my prayer I can only make a weeping-like face, but weeping does not come through.’ The Imam said, ‘Yes, even (tears) of the size of the head of a fly (are very good).”’

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لِأَبِي بَصِيرٍ إِنْ خِفْتَ أَمْراً يَكُونُ أَوْ حَاجَةً تُرِيدُهَا فَابْدَأْ بِاللَّهِ وَ مَجِّدْهُ وَ أَثْنِ عَلَيْهِ كَمَا هُوَ أَهْلُهُ وَ صَلِّ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ سَلْ حَاجَتَكَ وَ تَبَاكَ وَ لَوْ مِثْلَ رَأْسِ الذُّبَابِ إِنَّ أَبِي ( عليه السلام ) كَانَ يَقُولُ إِنَّ أَقْرَبَ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنَ الرَّبِّ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ هُوَ سَاجِدٌ بَاكٍ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza who said,

‘Abu Abdullahasws said to Abu Baseer, ‘If you fear a matter taking place or a need which you require, so begin with Allahazwj and Glorify Himazwj and Extol upon Himazwj just as Heazwj is Rightful of it, and send Blessings upon the Prophetsaww and ask your need, and try to cry and even if it (the teardrop) is like the head of the fly. The Prophetsaww was saying: ‘The closest of what the servant can be from the Lordazwj Mighty and Majestic is when performing Sajdah and while he is weeping’.
en.sarwar: 10. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Ali ibn abu Hamza who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said to abu Basir, ‘If you are afraid of something or need help, then begin with Allah and His glory and praise Him as He deserves. Then ask Allah’s favors for the Holy Prophet and ask for help, tiy to weep even if your tears are of the size of the head of a fly. Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) would say, ‘a servant (of Allah) in prostration and weeping is in the nearest position to Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/58)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ الْبَجَلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنْ لَمْ يَجِئْكَ الْبُكَاءُ فَتَبَاكَ فَإِنْ خَرَجَ مِنْكَ مِثْلُ رَأْسِ الذُّبَابِ فَبَخْ بَخْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin al Mugheira, from Ismail Al Bajaly,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘It the weeping does not come to you, and if there comes out from you (a tear drop) like the head of the fly, so congratulations, congratulations!’
en.sarwar: 11. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Isma’Il al-Bajilli from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “If weeping does not come through, make a weeping-like face. If of the size of the head of a fly tears come out that is your sheer good luck indeed.”
